intro: Euacer austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian euacer, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in dense clusters during the summer months. Euacer austriacum is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats.
